challenge.title: Write Arrow Functions with Parameters
challenge.description:
Just like a regular function, you can pass arguments into an arrow function.

const doubler = (item) => item * 2;
doubler(4);

doubler(4) would return the value 8.

If an arrow function has a single parameter, the parentheses enclosing the parameter may be omitted.

const doubler = item => item * 2;

It is possible to pass more than one argument into an arrow function.

const multiplier = (item, multi) => item * multi;
multiplier(4, 2);

multiplier(4, 2) would return the value 8.
challenge.instructions: Rewrite the myConcat function which appends contents of arr2 to arr1 so that the function uses arrow function syntax.

tests.text: myConcat should be a constant variable (by using const).
myConcat should be an arrow function with two parameters
